main event: Sighting of three unidentified flying objects near East Point, Georgia on May 10, 1954
interesting points: The objects were described as round, about 20 feet in diameter, with a thick center and thin outer edges, and a metallic luster.
The objects were observed traveling at an estimated speed of 600-700 mph, in a straight horizontal flight path at an altitude of around 1,000 feet.
The objects were observed by a civilian witness, and no vapor trail or exhaust was seen.
The sighting lasted for approximately 30 seconds before the objects flew out of sight.
Air traffic control and radar installations in the area reported no record of the objects.
